com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j

Class JsonRpcHttpAsyncClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.JsonRpcHttpAsyncClient

  • public class JsonRpcHttpAsyncClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements an asynchronous JSON-RPC 2.0 HTTP client. This class has a dependency on Apache Commons Codec, Apache Because this implementation uses an HTTP request pool, timeouts are controlled at a global level, rather than per-request.

    The following JVM system properties control the behavior of the pool:

    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.async.socket.timeout - overall socket idle (keep-alive) timeout in milliseconds, default is 30 seconds
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.async.connect.timeout - socket connect timeout in milliseconds, default is 30 seconds
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.async.socket.buffer - socket buffer size in bytes, default is 8Kb (8192 bytes)
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.async.tcp.nodelay - true to use TCP_NODELAY, false to disable, default is true
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.async.max.inflight.route - maximum number of in-flight requests per route (unique URL, minus query string), default is 500
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.async.max.inflight.total - maximum number of total in-flight requests (across all providers), default is 500
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.async.reactor.threads - number of asynchronous IO reactor threads, default is 2 (more than sufficient for most clients)

    • Method Detail

      • setSSLContext

        public static void setSSLContext(javax.net.ssl.SSLContext sslContext)
        Set the SSLContext to be used to create SSL connections. This method most be called before the first JsonRpcHttpAsyncClient is constructed, otherwise it has no effect.
        Parameters:
        sslContext - the SSLContext to use

      • invoke

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object> invoke(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                            java.lang.Object argument)
        Invokes the given method with the given arguments and returns immediately. The Future object that is returned can be used to retrieve the result.
        Parameters:

        argument - the arguments to the method
        Returns:
        the response Future<T>
